ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: learned a ton about different traditional medical practices from various cultures and communities + how we can integrate them into the modern medical complex
I learned a lot about interconnecting various cultures/topics to understand the overarching theme of what was being discussed

This class provided a historical framework of the American medical system and its treatment of various traditional medicine forms since the 18th century to modern political/cultural discourse around traditional medicine.
Learned about approaches to medicine throughout American history, and the professionalization of the medical industry.
This course taught me a lot about different forms of traditional medicines and the role they played throughout history

Everything that was promised on the syllabus!
I learned the histories and contemporary manifestations of various traditional medicines in the US. I learned to think critically about racial, cultural, and gender processes that shape traditional medicines. I learned to use respectful language when writing about people in the past. I learned to write an ethnographic research paper.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: i absolutely loved this class, one of my favorites at yale! everything from the reading to Ximena's teaching style to the conversations, really made it a great time e
The course was really fascinating! Topics were always so interesting and class discussions felt engaging.

Strengths: I had never learned about this material explicitly before and the readings/lectures are very interesting and novel material. Prof Lopez Carrillo is also a passionate and kind seminar leader. 

Weaknesses: Sometimes the readings were a bit dense/I wasn't exactly sure what we were supposed to be focusing on until coming to class. Themes also repeated quite a bit between class discussions, and I would have liked a bit more variety in our medical pluralism discussions.
Strengths- Professor Lopez Carrillo is a great lecturer, and well-organized. I felt that I learned a lot of information but it wasnt overwhelming.
The class was a bit unorganized as there wasnt much information about assignments. However, the professor was extremely supportive and it was an amazing class overall.

Professor Lopez Carrillo is an amazing professor. Her lectures are clear, and she has many incites that encourages really great and thought-provoking questions and discussions in class. She is supportive, attentive, invested, and really helpful when it comes to our individual research projects. I have no complaints about the class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: yes yes yes!! this class was everything and more
Yes!! Professor Lopez Carrillo is now one of my favorite professors, ever. She is extremely knowledgeable in her field and the class was incredibly interesting
Yes, if you are interested in learning about the formation of the medical system in the United States and ways to combat its inequalities/histories of alternative forms of medicine.
Yes! Any class with Professor Lopez Carrillo is one Id take.
Yes! The class topic is interesting, the readings are phenomenal, the professor is amazing!

extras.title: ER&M 309 01 - Traditional Medicine in the US
